intro: Tontelea serrata, commonly known as the serrated tontelea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges and small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows in tropical rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
